summary: The Customs Facilitation Act of 2025 aims to modernize and streamline customs processes to facilitate trade and enhance trade enforcement. It establishes a Border Interagency Executive Council to coordinate efforts across various federal agencies. The bill focuses on improving cargo processing, modernizing the Automated Commercial Environment, simplifying drawback procedures, streamlining export processes, and increasing transparency through better data collection and website updates. It also addresses agency response deadlines and improves contact information accessibility.
